key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, are expecting their second child.
A spokesperson confirmed the news, stating Archie will become a big brother.
The couple shared a black and white photograph with Meghan showcasing her bump.
Photographer and friend Misan Harriman congratulated them publicly.
Buckingham Palace expressed the royal family's delight over the news.
The new baby will be eighth in line to the throne and anticipated to have the surname Mountbatten-Windsor.
Harry remains in the line of succession despite stepping back as a senior royal.
Meghan previously disclosed experiencing a miscarriage last summer.
The announcement follows shortly after the royal family celebrated Princess Eugenie's first child.
Harry and Meghan have been establishing their new life in California, securing deals with Netflix and Spotify.
